caption: I’ve only had the sweet potato donuts and coffee but they are yummy! Donuts aren’t too sweet and are like a light moist cake donut 👌  I got an oat milk latte with an extra shot of espresso and it was perfect!
The food is really good here and I highly recommend you try them out. I love the their menu options and the service is always great.

I went there for Valentine's day. I know that's a tough one for restaurants, but the server was was surly, and only some of the food was as good as it should be for one Michelin star. Some of it was definitely underwhelming.

My bestie took me out for dinner and I'd have to say I was disappointed. What was good? The wine, the bread, and the dessert. We had some kind of crumpet as a starter-no flavor at all.  The main course was short ribs with a sauce that congealed, although that might have been causes by the cold. Also, the woman who greeted me touched my forehead with a thermometer. I don't think it had been sanitized in any way. Yuck. Very nice staff.
Love this place! Not only the food is great, the service is amazing, but also during covid times you feel super safe.
Ordered a sweet potato donut and a banana latte. Donut was good, but the latte was room temperature and I couldn’t taste any banana. It tasted like an unsweetened latte, maybe they made it wrong?

Little Pearl deserves its Michelin Star. One of my favorites in DC, Little Pearl offers a constantly evolving menu to challenge your palette and keep you coming back for more. You’ll be treated to a pre-fixe menu with add-on options and pairings. The dishes are diverting and elegantly presented. The outdoors dining yard is beautiful and well adjusted to safe pandemic dining.

Gluten free and dairy free people rejoice!  As an amateur foodie with wheat and dairy allergies, I have been discouraged by the limited menu options at many restaurants - but Little Pearl was incredible. They accommodated each part of their carefully crafted prix fixe menu to be gluten- and dairy-free, and everything was absolutely delicious and beautifully plated. Thank you, thank you!
Incredible service and delicious inventive dishes. I've yet to find a better priced meal of those quality anywhere else in DC. Also, a really fun wine selection.
They had great safety procedures in place and made the best of a difficult situation.  Besides, the food was great!

This is my very first time to this establishment but it will not be my last. they have preset menus that change every week or so therefore it's a high probability that when you come you will not have the things that I had however everything was delicious. Make sure that you make a reservation because they are very popular and very busy.
1 Michelin star restaurant with Michelin experience. Excellent 6 course meal. Steamed halibut entree star of the show. Reasonable price for the restaurant status. Will visit again. 5/5.

I finally decided to take a chance and eat outside during COVID. I’m glad I did. From the time I walked up to the entrance to finishing my meal, I was really pleased at the measures they took to ensure the health and safety of their staff and the customers were first. The six course vegetarian option was phenomenal with a beautiful complement of savory and sweet in some of their dishes. It was a little chilly that evening but they offered a heater to bring near your table. The only thing I’d add would be some Ella or Nina for music.

Kyle and Izzie made our experience truly amazing! The courses could stand alone, but the service made us feel welcome and at home. Will surely be back not just for the food and delicious cocktails, but for the people!
Love Little Pearl. The service was incredible! Covid precautions the best I've seen.

Just a bit of FYI, the dinner pairing is $54 per person in additional to the $54 per person for the dinner reservation. They may or may not tell you, as the waiter did not inform my party of this additional $54 per person. It was referenced as part of the reservation. Just some consumer knowledge so you aren't as surprised as we were. Otherwise, the dishes were well made.
My new favorite DC coffee shop! So much natural light with a great neighborhood feel. Banana Lattes and vegetarian tostadas were great. Will be back 🤩  Update: had dinner here and WOW... 6 stars
Mixed service, tasty food
6 courses and each one was delicious. I would suggest they add some mosquito candles, margarita was good, but small for $14.

The food is served in very attractive dishes—they seem to pay more attention to the dishware than many other places I’ve been. I had the six course set menu for the patio, and it was awesome. Very complex flavors. I was afraid the portions would be too big for six courses, but actually it’s just right. Would for sure return. Good value for price.
Delicious food in a beautiful setting. Perfect for a romantic dinner or a special occasion with friends.
Lovely outdoor garden, early evening dinner. 6 courses, wine pairing matched well.
Social distancing and great food. On a nice night....tables across the lawn. Romantic. Wear long pants and socks (mosquitoes).

Nothing short of amazing (and let’s be honest, that saying a lot for ANY takeout).  My wife and I hadn’t yet decided on a restaurant to celebrate our 1 year wedding anniversary, but we ended up choosing Little Pearl the night of. Though we were past the deadline for takeout orders (still COVID season) for that night, the hostess graciously fit us in and accommodated a meal for two. And, when we casually mentioned it was our anniversary at the pickup window, they threw in an extra gift!  We both thought our meal was superb. Service and food was so wonderful that we even discussed making Little Pearl our yearly tradition on our anniversary. Kudos to the team for winning a regular diner!

So well run during the reopening phase of the virus. Each employee had masks. All patrons are temperature checked and wear masks until seated. The food is incredible and the fixed menu makes it such a great experience to sit back and enjoy the brilliance of the chef. 100% recommend a this oasis in capital hill.
Fantastic food.
Beautiful space, great coffee
Wonderful cafe in the morning with wonderful staff and innovative espresso drinks. Food is unbelievably tasty! Haven't been able to eat dinner there, but can't wait to try it.
Amazing Fried Chix Sandwich and Sweet Potato Donut! Nice view with garden patio and relaxing environment. I can enjoy myself here all afternoon!

The food and service were amazing! I had high expectations after dining at Pineapple and Pearls a few times and Little Pearl did not disappoint! The prices were reasonable too. My favorite course was the sea scallop over cauliflower puree, and the truffle ice cream with chocolate ganache was also incredible! Each course was exciting and delicious. Highly recommend!

If you are looking for original cuisine and atypical flavors you are at the right address. You will never be disappointed. The different dishes offered are like a discovery. Unfortunately  to accompany a good dish we expect a nice wine list. That's far from being the case. The selection does not make sense, the prices are indecent. It’s a shame because it ruins the accompagnement. Especially  since it is not so complicated to offer good wines at fair prices.

What a wonderful experience. The food was really delicious, and reasonable. The service was fantastic, all very helpful and insightful. The ambiance was really nice too, sadly it wasn't quite spring yet but I have no doubt the garden is beautiful. Would happily go back.
Great atmosphere day and night. Their patio is amazing in the summer. Staffs are great. Coffee is good. Food is..interesting
Coffee house by day, wine bar by night, set in a lovely, vintage setting with a patio.
Prix fixe menu was great! Vegetarian Carbonara was my favorite!

A modern and intimate casual restaurant serving tasty, fresh food. A good place to stop on Capitol Hill. A helpful employee let me drop off my luggage for an hour until I could return for my lunch date.

This is a review of their coffee bar which is open in the morning. The drinks are all delicious. The London Fog is sooo good. But it's the donut that steals the show. It's the perfect donut. It's light, airy, and dusted with cinnamon sugar. Get the donut. Don't plan on sharing. You will just get another donut. It's also a good quiet place to work for a little while. Get the donut.

They offer 7 dishes pre-fix dinner. Angel’s eggs were a novel mix of sweetness of merengue and mayo-york. Three types of caviar in butter was too greasy for me. I wanted to taste them without butter. Scallop was my favorite. Flavors of different ingredients blended well. Carbonara pasta with duck york was mediocre. The main dish was seared pork belly and pulled pork. It was too heavy for my stomach. Service was excellent. The noise level was very high.

We absolutely loved this place and will be back for sure! Customer service on point from the very friendly front desk lady to our awesome, cool and experienced waitress and the rest of the waiters that helped her our throughout our AMAZING dinner. Food was incredibly surprising and delicious and we thought we would leave hungry since the portions are small but we were proven wrong! Everything in this place is to be forever remembered. Thank you for an unforgettable experience, looking forward to the next menu!
Great breakfast and friendly service.
The best neighborhood cafe. Even though it's busy on weekends you can almost always find a table.
Don’t take espresso is really bad!!

This dining experience was fantastic. First off, the setting is great. The dining room is filled with small little rooms, which creates a very romantic vibe. The building is well lit, though the door is not easy to locate. The food was fantastic. We had a six course dinner which featured the classics. Everything was well cooked, the portions were well sized given the number of courses, and the cocktails were great. The wait staff was very, very helpful. They recommended great wine, offered information about the food, and were friendly, but didn't dominate. We paid for the two dinners when we made the reservation, so all we paid for were drinks and the tip when we left, which was also nice. I'd go back in a heartbeat!

Amazing!  My friend and I visited Little Pearl to celebrate his birthday, and we were not disappointed.  We had a lovely array of food in their "Classics" assortment, each on having a unique take on a traditional dish.  Some dishes appealed to me more than others, but the quality in everything was apparent.  But best of all, our service was wonderful!  Cosmo was gracious, and did a fantastic job explaining the dishes.  He also was able to give my friend a taste of their pear sorbet, and my friend had a total Ratatouille moment.  It was an excellent evening from start to finish!
The chicken sandwich and Bloody Mary are Fire!
Every meal I have eaten here has been delicious. The menu is never stale. They keep it fresh. The atmosphere is great. The lighting is warm and cozy.
Unbelievable.

Little Pearl is a gem (I have only been there for coffee and lunch). The food/drinks are outstanding, although pricey. It has kind of an exclusive vibe, just FYI. It's pretty fancy - not just a local coffee shop.
It's clear they earned their Michelin star

Little Pearl is a good coffee shop and a good dinner restaurant, however it's not spectacular at either. For dinner, the food and wine pairings are wonderful, but the space is relatively uncomfortable - almost like you're having an expensive, well-curated dining experience in a coffee shop. Some of the tables are of the metal patio variety and the chairs are comfortable for about 30 minutes before the squirming adjustments set in. The coffee is great, but don't expect to ever really be a regular here as the staff doesn't seem to remember anyone. Therefore, it doesn't feel like a neighborhood spot, but an anonymous special occasion place. With a slight "vibe" change, this place could truly be spectacular.
Chill cafe to just relax and do some work with pretty good food.
Cute place to grab breakfast on the weekends. Upscale relaxed vibe. The place could use a bit more seating.

Don't walk in off the cold street expecting a warm welcome. Went solo (12/19 evening) after reading reviews. I now know what the word "sneer" means. See my review for nearby Acqua Al (italian) for a contrast.
Fun dining experience.   The food was inventive and delicious.
Outstanding pre-fixe menu, perfectly attentive and accommodating waitstaff, and fascinating flavor combinations of excellent prepared foods. Will happily return.

Had truffle dinner 2.0 and there was so much truffle! Some really interesting combinations especially the truffle french toast for dessert. Ambience was nice and the food wasn't overly fussy, but we'll presented and tasty.

Been here for dinner, done the tasting menu, and been to the cafe. If you take them for what they say they are (a Cafe and Wine bar) this place is excellent.  The small plates for dinner are good and the burger is fun. The cocktails are good too. At less than $50 the tasting menu is a bargain. Very few good restaurants will have a tasting menu priced that low. Let alone a restaurant that is well reviewed in a major US city.  The Cafe (items pictured below) is on the expensive side especially with the up-charge for the nut milks, but the sweet potato donuts is fantastic and the chicken sandwich is up there with the best.  The cache some people expect with Little Pearl now wielding a Michelin star seems to be hurting the restaurants in these reviews. Not all starred restaurants are formal places (there are even street vendors with stars in other parts of the world) and relatively low cost for the quality means that the menu and the service are quite a bit less than its also star struck siblings.
Amazing food and service. From the moment we walked in we were in awe. They definitely earned their Michelin star.

Having eaten at several Michelin starred reaturants (including internationally), I was disappointed. Poor and slow service.  Two of the seven courses were far too basic and tasteless. Limited drink menu.  Good palette cleanser and unique dessert. Overall, mediacore at best.

This place is just amazing. The food was perfect, the wine pairing was ideal, and the price is absurdly reasonable. Did I mention the service? I’m so happy to have found myself at this remarkable and creative restaurant. Then I found myself welcomed and catered to in a way that is surprising and delighting. Please, give this unique and remarkable restaurant your business. This is what service is all about. Candice was remarkable and she defined the best service I’ve had in months. Thank you.
Absolutely loved it! Especially the price! Single dinner friendly, attentive staff.
Interesting spot.

Great place, and food tastes awesome. BUT for the past two seasons their menu options don’t reflect the season changes. If you come here regularly and have only 4-5 options to choose from, you are bound to get bored with the choices. Popular items go off the menu to be experimented with items that don’t fit the season and palate. I hope they bring their zing back.
7 course Pre fixed menu for 49$. The food was amazing and so was the cocktail and wine selection.  They also offer snacks for the bar/patio area.
Emma W was fantastic. Her wine knowledge was impressive and the food was ofcourse terrific. Definitely recommend!
Delicious espresso, must try the sweet potato doughnut, the chicken sandwich and cookies are a dope. Everything I've had here is good, all W's no L's lol.  Go forth, eat and drink!
Service was excellent. Thank you Roman and Chef Whitney

Such a special, fun place for an incredibly delicious meal! We went for a special occasion and it seemed like many of the couples around us were as well. One of us is vegetarian and the other is not, and they seamlessly were able to account for dietary needs. Every course was amazing- creative, thoughtful, and just plain delicious. The wine pairing was lovely as well. Service was excellent as was ambience. We felt like we were getting a great value for such a nice, multi-course meal. I plan to go back and definitely will recommend this place to others!

When Little Pearl first opened i wasn't seeing very good reviews. But after they made the 2020 Michelin list, I had to go check it out for myself. For $49, 7 course meal the food quality was amazing, service exceptional, and you start to really appreciate the creativity of the chefs. I highly recommend you make your way here before it gets even more crowded.

Unimpressive.  If butter is the new Michelin standard, then it's undeniable for its win.  In fact, if butter is the only flavor, then it really should have earned a few more stars.  The hash brown that begins the meal tastes like a square cube version of a McDonald's hashbrown - it's butter oily flavor overpowers the hollandaise chive sauce that it is dolloped with on top.  The prawns that looked promising with its light batter, also were super oily without hints of any other flavor.  The toast with the honey brie was laden with butter as if the toast was pan fried in one stick of butter until crispness.  The butter in the toast is so overpowering you can hardly taste the delicate flavors of the brie and honey.  The toast of the same degree of butter feel is again repeated in a grilled cheese and tomato soup pairing.  The soup alone is a bit creamy enough to balance the tomato acidity, but nothing to wow over.  For what otherwise is a classic comfort food, it hardly gave that warm and fuzzy feeling.  Also to note: the spoon does not sit still in the small wooden soup bowl. So guests at the table experienced unexpected spillage which can be a bit of an annoyance if you want to take a rest between bites and are unaware of where else to lay your spoon. The pork is presented with a honey mustard sauce, again nothing you haven't tasted before or maybe even better at a barbeque joint.  The mussels came with...wait for it...yes the butter laden toast!  Usually, you look forward to dipping the bread in the mussels broth, however the toast had so much of its own butter it could barely absorb the mussel broth. Also the mussels were presented standing up and offered a great presentation perhaps, but were dry because the broth was beneath, in a sea of its own. The only exciting item which showcased creativity is the faux deviled eggs where the egg white is made of meringue. That was the only night's pause on butter flavor.
Incredible experience!! All of the courses were amazing and varied, and overall it was a delicious and interesting meal. The service is also wonderful and the space is very appealing and intimate.
FABULOUS experience, and incredible value for the price. Get the wine pairing, you won't be disappointed. Cocktails, food, service - everything was outstanding. I can't recommend it highly enough.

Fine dining and "good value" are not often used in the same sentence in Washington.  The dinner I had at Little Pearl was both delicious, and a good value for the tasting menu at 49 bucks.  The space is unpretentious and thoughtfully designed, particularly enjoyed the bananas in the bathroom.  Most of all, our server, Candace, was outstanding.  Professional, warm, and knows her stuff.
Awesome service but I’d prefer a seating inside.

My visit to Little Pearl was scrumptious! Each course was a delight and the wait staff was very pleasant. We sat outside and it was dreamy, a great atmosphere for such an delectable meal. I hope to visit again and try the tasting menu once the season changes. Oh and the fun and funky wine pairing was one of the best selections I've had in DC. 🍷
Sweet Potato Doughnut 💯 Frittata - meh. $8 sliver was fine. Wife makes better frittata.
Stopped by weekend morning. Not a huge fan of frittatas, but they were good at Little Pearl. Also can't go wrong with the half-baked cookie

So this is a slightly skewed review as we went for the Truffle dinner they just hosted. I was very underwhelmed. First off, they brought shared plates that were very small they looked like they were for one person but they were for 2. We ordered the vegetarian menu, our friends ordered the regular one.  1st course was sort of truffle croquette with garlic aioli. It was good but I wish it had more sauce.  2nd course was either a beef or beet tartare. It was delicious! But again, the portion size was incredibly small and my friend and I shared one plate. Good thing we were fair and let each person have half.  3rd course Carolina Golden Rice. This was good but something was missing. Great presentation though. I wish it was bigger. Thankfully this was the one dish they separated for each of us to have our own small cup. It was risotto-esque.  4th course was AWFUL! It was the main course too. Friends got duck confit and chicken thigh. They said it was dry and the waitress poured the sauce on just one part so it lost flavor. We were given these trumpet mushrooms with truffles. The mushrooms completely lacked the truffle flavor as it was completely covered in this overly powerful asian sauce of some kind. And for some reason that dish made me incredibly nauseous a few hours later. I just know it was that dish for some reason. I know they were trying to be original but why wouldn't they do a homemade pasta dish with truffles. It would have been so so much better.  5th course was great and very interesting but again, it was so small and I had to share it with my friend. We were good about sharing half with each other but it was tempting not to. It was some sort of chocolate tart and had truffle ice cream on the side. It worked well. Never would have imagined having truffle ice cream in my life.  I know truffles are expensive but for over $100 person I really thought we would have our own plates and slightly larger courses. Very disappointing.  I do think I will plan to go back sometime in the future to try a meal not on truffle night though.

Loved the ambiance and the food. Each item served was better than the next. The buildup to the final course was quite outstanding. I would have given the place 5 stars, but the timing of wine to food was a little off. By the time we received our food we were finished with the wine pairing for that course. The server did realize this by the last entrée and provided us a free pour.
Great favorite! Food ambiance decor location staff gardens....
Worth every penny!

I have been here a few times, and the food is always delicious. The staff is always friendly and explains the menu well. I came this time to a test menu of fresh vegetables, fried okra, pork belly with smoked potato salad, and a corn cake. As always everything tasted amazing. I hope the pork and corn cake get added to the regular menu.
The spicy chicken sandwich is amazing! Also the sweet potato donut! This is a perfect little cafe to get great quality food!
(Translated by Google) Delicious food, good atmosphere, affordable price, very fond of  (Original) อาหารอร่อยบรรยากาศดีราคาไม่แพงชอบมาก

I’ve been here for breakfast and dinner. Amazing and chic coffee shop by day with a thoughtful selection of pastry and breakfast and light lunch items. To be compared to no other, are their delicious one of a kind drinks. Affordable for an exotic insta worthy and memorable experience.  Dinner is art, be prepared to be amazed by the creativity, flavor, craft and love that goes into every course.  Enough can’t be said about the amazing staff and owner who make this little slice of heaven a reality in DC on the daily. Thank you.

Been here before and loved it, and of course, Rose’s Luxury and Pineapple & Pearl are fantastic. Completely disappointed with last night’s fixed course menu and wine pairings.  Three of the eight courses are desert, with one inedible cheese dish (see other reviews below corroborating this).  The “fancy” wine pairing was $59 and consisted of 4 pours, totaling probably 1.5 glasses of wine (if that).  Very underwhelming.  We never complain, but the manager could tell something was off with us and came over and had a nice discussion. Hopefully this isn’t a new trend over there.
Fantastic experience! Waitstaff were friendly and accommodating, and the meal was great. Thank you!

So very poor and underwhelming. The staff were ok, but very unprofessional. The wine service was so lowly skilled it was laughable (literally). The food was designed to be inventive and clever but really it was all just “fluff”. One course was literally “tots” with a bland dressing. One course a fairly mediocre squash “soup”. The cheese course was vile, completely inedible, at this point we were laughing. 8 courses for $49, three of which were deserts. The wine selections were very good, to be fair.
Great tomato menu!

A well thought out menu, with well-attuned wine parings, absolutely worthy of a visit. The food itself was second only to the quality of Little Pearl's staff. Candice and company were outstanding - providing expert analysis of each dish, welcoming curious questions as we journeyed through our meal. 10/10 would readily visit again.
Delicious and a must if you are in Washington

Get their special lates! You won’t regret it! Also the potato doughnuts are soooo good. The are topped with a cinnamon sugar topping that get everywhere but it’s worth it! Also I really like that they have gender neutral bathrooms. And are very accommodating for handicapped people.
Lovely indoor and outdoor space.  Perfect for a quiet cup of coffee or connecting with others.  Excellent coffee and quality service
Excellent experience! The food. The pairings, the company. We had to wait a long time to get our reserved table but it was worth it. Highly recommend!
Two words...Chicken Sandwich!!!

Delicious coffee. Loved the atmosphere and the design of the space. The spicy chicken was yummy. The spinach and sundries tomato frittata was not great, but I enjoyed the experience overall. The sweet potato doughnut was interesting but a bit too dense.

Lovely spot for coffee, food, a date, or a meeting.  Relaxing and clean inside and outside, restrooms included. Fair prices, too.  I ordered a London Fog with cashew milk and it was perfect, not too sweet and the perfect temperature.  Would definitely be my go-to spot if I lived in the area.

What a wonderful space, both indoors and outdoors. The coffee is delicious (I had it with their walnut milk) and the potato donut was the star of the show this time around. We sat outside on the grass and enjoyed our beverages on a Saturday afternoon. This place got crowded. The indoor seating area is beautiful - floor to ceiling windows, sliding doors, wood finish. Short walk from Eastern Market.
Hip and quaint at the same time. Super nice staff!
Excellent food, atmosphere and an excellent and affordable tasting menu.
Delicious coffee!

This place is adorable. They have great food and drinks and the property it's on is beautiful. Great for a few people, families, and dog friendly. Shaded areas make it nice to sit outside. Also has a greenhouse area which is super unique and a great spot to sit and have a drink.

It’s the best cafe in Capitol Hill. Much more than just coffee and baked goods. The breakfast taco and spicy fried chicken are must haves. Great, relaxed atmosphere.  The staff are extremely helpful and informative.
Beautiful experience, from the garden ambiance to the wine and creative food. The staff is very friendly and understanding. Will definitely be back!

Instantly one of my favorite breakfast restaurants to go to on a nice day or  even on a rainy day and sit in the sun room/green house room and watch the rain. This room is decorated well with a lot of plants and a great Dan Monick piece. Little pearl is a gem. The food is really good, the potato donuts are awesome, not too sweet. They have interesting drink choices as well. Banana latte anyone? The service is too notch. Really cool how they hand write on the counters. This is a very unique experience and the ambience will have you coming back again and again.

DO. THE. TASTING. MENU. I rank this spot as one of the best restaurants I’ve been to in DC. The tasting menu builds like a Beethoven’s symphony and crescendos into...a cheeseburger. Not kidding. And dang it’s a cheeseburger you’ll never forget.  Great service. They walk you through everything.
So cute!

Living about three blocks away, I’ve been here several times - in the morning, evening, and afternoon. It’s a beautiful space, and they have a large patio and lawn area, which is why if you come here most mornings, you’ll find a lot of young families.  It’s probably only worthwhile coming here if you are also enjoying the space. While some of the things on their menu can be interesting, it is often times too salty or too sweet or too rich, all the while being pricy. Furthermore, I find the set-up of the restaurant to be less than ideal - the interior is compartmentalized and cramped.
Small dishes, but extremely tasty.
The wine list was great. Didn't get much to eat but the service at the bar was wonderful. Had a very nice time.

This is in a nice location off Barracks Row, next to the Old Naval Hospital. It's run by the same chef as Pineapple and Pearls, but is much less expensive and more casual. But they still have a tasting menu! The tasting menu is much simpler than Pineapple and Pearls, but still very creative and enjoyable. They also offer a simpler and less expensive wine pairing, which was enough wine for me. The night I was there, they featured organic wines from Greece that were quite good. The food itself was also very good, and the service was great as well. Some reviewers have complained that they were still hungry after the tasting menu, but I thought it was enough. I don't enjoy a tasting menu where I'm too full to enjoy the end of it. The crowd here is in their twenties, mostly. I think I was the oldest person in there. The ambience is nice, with the restaurant set well back from the street.

POSITIVE: Great location with a cool, relaxed vibe. Nice wait staff.  NEGATIVE: Seriously overpriced food that is considerably subpar.  Dressing up a couple tater tots with a dot of colored mayo is not a "dish." After our 8 course meal - we actually had a conversation about hitting up another restaurant.
Outstanding food and service especially for the relatively reasonable price.  The restaurant does hide in plain sight due to the tasteful but overly understated signage
Great food and love their hand-written table signs.
Sweet, intimate spot. Fixed menu was truly stellar, staff was kind
Nice place. Quiet area far from downtown dc. Workers very helpful and nice
Decent set menu. Reasonable price. Good flavors. Very accommodating to special dietary restrictions. I would recommend it for a nice evening out with friends or a date.
First time here. Cozy little place. Had breakfast. You need to try the sweet potato donut, simply awesome!
Always delivers (dont think they have delivery)
With a tasting menu in place and special dinners Little Pearl is establishing itself as a top restaurant in DC but at an amazing price point ! An amazing meal for an amazing price .
Great and intimate place to enjoy the night. The music is always great and the food is even better! Make sure you check out the themed dinners that occur once a month. 90's night was great!
Accessible food with a twist, great wine pairings and service. Don't expect to leave stuffed but your mouth and soul will be oh so satisfied.
We were super excited to eat here, but the food was aggressively fine. Service seemed put off. Can't recommend.

After reading reviews of this place and hearing good things about it. I was really excited for the night. I had called up twice before we went, once to book and once to push the booking back 30 minutes and everything seemed great.  Although about 3 hours before our reservation, I was called up and informed that, although I had booked 2 months early, I was just now being told that it was a special night and therefore it would be double the price - $85/head. I still thought that, as this was the case, it would be well worth it and much more special, so we still went. When we got there, we were placed in a room that was freezing - it was a February evening in DC and it was warmer outside. We then waited for about 20 minutes to get our first course. This tasted excellent (hence 2 stars).  Over the course of the evening, we received 7 more courses of food (read mouthfuls of food).  We went away extremely hungry after our $200 dinner.  I would have certainly expected a lot lot more for that price, I had assumed on the phone that it would include the wine pairing that they advertise, but no such luck.  I could have spent the night in my garden with a packet of chips and been just as full, and a lot warmer. Furthermore, not once during 8 courses were we ever asked how anything was.  Pretty disappointing evening, and I will certainly let people know should they ask.
Not much here. Staff totally uninterested in helping you, then request an 18% tip. No sides available, two sandwiches and a salad for 42.00$. I will pass next time.
Perfect place to go if you want a $200 check for splitting a hamburger as your main course.

This place is magnificent!!! Recently, moved to DC and worried I was never going to find a place that was delicious, comfortable, friendly, inventive—little pearl is everything. My only quibble is they don’t have any NA beverage options. Lots of wonderful craft beers are now NA including Bravus and WellBeing Brewery. Also Seedlip is a great NA spirit.

This is maybe one of my favorite neighborhood fixtures, I'd say I pretty consistently get a potato doughnut (possibly the best doughnut I've ever had) and a Vietnamese iced coffee at least once every weekend (twice if I can). Also, my favorites easy spot to grab an impromptu brunch.

Being a regular customer at this fine dining place, I should have rated them higher because food is very good and staff is friendly, efficient and accommodating. But tonight’s experience (in particular) at this place merits a ‘Zero’ Star. After waiting for almost 45-50 minutes in a not too busy restaurant, the fancy burger arrives cold to touch and the bun is colder. The manager kindly offered to have the meal prepared again but I had to decline as time was of essence. I am hoping that this is a one off experience and am reporting this to help the restaurant better manage their processes and keep their well-deserved reputation as a fine dining place.
One of the best prix fixe dinners in the city!
Amazing tasting menu, perfect portions and creative recipes, great service.
Music was a bit longer for conversation. But nice location and atmosphere.
Yummy

Little Pearl has a small cafe menu, and its fried chicken sandwich is the star of the show. Awesome bread, tasty chicken, and a spicy sauce. Simple but one of DC’s best. Tacos also looked great. Order and pay at the bar, take a name stand, then grab a table or a seat at a communal table, and an employee will find you with your order.
Best cafe and casual dining around.
Breakfast taco was a little pathetic looking and too expensive for what it was. Coffee was fine
An excellent meal, lovely wine selection, and informative staff.  Highly recommended!
Excellent
Such amazing food! The set menu with the wine pairings was fantastic. Ben was great there, too!
Perfect atmosphere.
Coffee isn't consistent.
Beautiful cafe serving great coffee and more.
Not a place for quiet cafe lovers. Packed with kids running around.
Great food for breakfast

I remembered portions to be a little more generous in my previous visits and if you read other reviews it seems others think the same, kind of overpriced for what they bring you. But, the food is delicious and the athmosphere is lovely. So you might want to pay more just for the enjoyment that this lovely space on the hill may bring to your senses.
Super cute restaurant with great food.
Coffee by day cocktails by night, awesome place!
Fantastic food, service, and wine!
Cute place set in a nice garden.
Great atmosphere. It translated perfectly from the front of pineapple and pearl to the former bayou bakery location

I had an amazing cookie. Go in the morning and have one for breakfast while they are still warm. Crisp outside, chewy inside with a sprinkling of sea salt on top.  Yum.  I wish the self serve water were cooler than room temperature,  but otherwise this was a lovely snack.
Interesting tasty food in a casual setting, with indoor and outdoor seating
Really great service and a fun menu

We've been to Little Pearl twice - once for breakfast/brunch and once for dinner.  I would give 5-stars to the brunch, which was fantastic and is really complemented by the bright, greenhouse-like feel of the dining space. The bloody mary was solid, and the coffee options are yummy. The dinner was fine, and I was not blown away by any means.  We got the burger, and it was just a good burger - would have expected more. The service was poor - it was difficult to get the attention of our waitress, and the dishes were very poorly timed (~25 minutes between some small plates).  Overall, we felt that the dinner was over-hyped and overpriced for what we got.
Nice variety of small plates and drinks.
Awesome place for quick bites and to relax in sun with friends ☀

It’s a fantastic little spot, but I have to agree with the other reviews that the dishes are too small for the prices they charge. The two of us had to keep ordering more food (which brought us to $150+) just to feel moderately satiated.  We were disappointed by the $36 lobster, which is a minuscule portion even with the tiny dumplings that come with it. However, the people who ordered the burger looked happy. So choose wisely.  Nevertheless, I was impressed by the creativity of the menu, the friendly service and the beautiful setting. We had a great night here.
Quaint little spot. Great vibes. Amazing wines. And that burger. Absolutely amazing. Small plates were very flavorful and unique. Will frequent this location more often.

Where to start? This place was awesome. acid in DC for 2 days and I've been there twice already. Once for lunch and once for dinner. Tried all the small plates love most. Fried chicken sandwich is amazing. Knowledgeable bartender including a new favorite. I will definitely be back.
Cute cafe. Great outdoor space and love the banana latte.

This is the perfect place for a date night. We had a lovely dinner on their beautiful patio. Little Pearl has a nice selection of wines both by the bottle and the glass. I had a flavorful cup of coffee. My partner and I split a number of their vegetarian dishes (e.g. Summer Peach Salad). Each was tasty. The service was superb and friendly. The restaurant's ambiance and sound feels good too. I look forward to trying it for lunch soon.
Delicious coffee and a Japanese chicken sandwich that’s out of this world! We weren’t crazy about the salmon toast. Cute place, great atmosphere and location.
Terrific even unique sandwiches.  Pleasant service.  Try to go on a day when you can sit on the patio, with well spaced tables and a terrific observation post for the Capitol Hill neighborhood.
Great salads. I wish it came in two sizes. Burger was too small. Charge a bit more and give a bigger patty. Sandwiches could be hit or miss. Gravlax was good but brisket was dry.
Planned on a nice evening with my husband, made a reservation and then got sat at a bar.  Walk ins got better seating.
This is a really cute restaurant. I went here for an office party and the food and wine was very delicious. I love the ambiance. The service was great too!
Food good but ridiculously long wait. Glass of wine was only half full
Great wine selection and innovative menu!
Great addition to DC. Wish we had more like it. The food is fab as is the ambience!
Really looking forward to this place. Food was average or worse. Service was terrible . This place sucked real bad.
Yum!! The eggplant sandwich is truly out of this world
Much better use of space, good lattes.
Food was okay, little pricey. No condiments.
Cute little spot on Capital Hill. And the food lives up to their trendy decor.

Great location, great wine list. The service is S...L...O...W! The food, while good, has teeny tiny portions. To their credit they do specify that they serve small plates, but I never expected the plates to be THAT small! Their fried potatoes are 4 pieces the size of Scrabble tiles. The order of deviled egg"s" is one half of one egg. My wife and I spent $120 and after leaving had to go straight to Trader Joe's for actual food because we were still starving.

,An oasis of peace and beauty on the grounds of the old Navy Hospital. The London Fog drink was so good that my wife and I each had a second cup at the end of our meal as we completed the Post crossword puzzle together. The Farro & Arugula salad was delicious and filling. My wife enjoyed the Gravlax & Sourdough breakfast sandwich, but said it was too much for so I got a few bites of that as well.  Indoor or outdoor seating. Nicely maintained gardens. And we had no trouble finding parking a block away. We will be back!
Pricey but the building is beautiful.

First time at the new location, which is really nice and has a great patio which is dog friendly. We had both of the fried chicken sandwich varieties and they were both excellent. The potato donut was one of the best donuts I've had and the churro were fresh and crispy. Service was great too, even though it's an order-at-the-front type place. Unfortunately, the lady taking our order misunderstood what I asked for and they only  brought out one sandwich. Thankfully, she corrected our order and we had the second sandwich out in a matter of minutes (and she gave us the donut free of charge as a way of apologizing, which was very nice of her and much appreciated). We'll be going back.

Passing by Little Pearl without giving it a look is to commit a crime on a social level. This place is intimate, it's beautiful, and by golly the wonderful people you find within will charm the pants off of you. Make sure you have a belt.  But, let us turn our attention to the Little Pearl Burger. It's not the burger you need, but the burger you deserve. Served on a freshly baked brioche bun you will find two cuts of beef that are the carnivorous equivalent of sheer, mouthwatering decadence. The beef is so delicious that I can only imagine this cow lived a fanciful life, rife with joy and triumph, only meeting its demise when it was good and ready, all the while surrounded by those that knew it best. This benevolent bovine offered itself as a sacrifice for the survival of others, and I cannot have been more honored to become one with it. I could go so far as to share the joy of the Russian sauce that topped this quixotic quadruped, one so good that it made me question my own democratic processes, but I must encourage you to take the journey for yourself and bask in the glory of this dish.  tl;dr cute place, badass burger. 7/5 would visit again.
Love love love this place. But damn did my food take forever to come... they make it look like it’s a fast casual place but it’s very very slow. Too slow. But still five stars.
Did not feel this lived up to the hype. Great atmosphere, but food took a long time. They had already been baked, so this was a delivery issue that could be fixed by management.
Amazing wine and atmosphere
Great spicy chicken sandwich, beautiful place outside to sit on the grass and enjoy (or at a table). Lives up to the hype!
Limited menu. The salmon sandwich I had was okay, the churros with chocolate sauce were great. The outdoor patio is wonderful.

I only took a star because this place is trying so hard to be cool that it's cringey. This review is for the wine bar. ( I tried to try the cafe, but it was honestly so crowded, there was no sense of where the line ended and began, that I got annoyed and left). The food selection at the wine bar includes only small plates: we had the potato terrine with salmon roe Hollandaise and the onion dip. There was also an okonomiyaki spring roll with a description that read "exactly how it sounds like". Gee how helpful!   Really knowledgeable wait staff more than makes up for it though.

What an absolute nightmare.  I was a huge fan of the Pineapple & Pearl coffee shop when it was back on 8th street.  Great coffee, chill vibe, fab pastries/food (shout out to the pineapple & pearl roll and the grilled cheese sandwich, neither of which made the transition to Little Pearl).  I was sad when they closed, but jazzed when I heard they'd be opening a bigger location.  Imagine, a place with the feel and quality of the Pineapple & Pearl Café, but where I could sit, relax, and enjoy time with friends!  What could go wrong?  Everything, evidently.  I visited this past weekend and couldn't have been more disappointed.  Sure, the coffee was still solid, but the pastries were trash--my friend's cinnamon bun was hard as a rock, as if it'd been left sitting out overnight, and my bread pudding was tough and flavorless.  Worse, however, was the atmosphere, which was the #1 thing I was looking for from Little Pearl.  The place was tourist and MOTH central.  Screaming children, parents who treated the entire seating area as their kid's playroom, tourists who spread out and shouted loudly at each other with no regard for the fact that all of us are squeezed together in a cramped, enclosed space.  Can Little Pearl control their clientele?  Perhaps not, but it appeared the place was actually designed to attract such a crowd.  Everything about Little Pearl, from the poorly laid out interior (how you order and pick up coffee is a joke) to the food and the atmosphere was unpleasant, frustrating, and pretty much the antithesis of what I was looking for in my local coffee shop.  I visited the old Pineapple & Pearl Café at LEAST twice a week...it'll be a miracle if I ever step foot in Little Pearl again.  Starbucks has pretty bad coffee, but honestly the Starbucks down the street has a cooler vibe, better food, and a more relaxing interior (props particularly to the top floor).  Note: I have not been to Little Pearl's nighttime wine bar incarnation, so I cannot speak to that.  It could be a completely different world at night; this review is only for the café.  Two stars are earned by the still-solid Vietnamese coffee, the mini sitting room that is the only thing that saved my sanity (the full seating area was an unmitigated trainwreck), and my fond memories of the greatness that was the Pineapple & Pearl Café (RIP).  Sadly, it seems the hype generated by the Pineapple and Pearl restaurant has poisoned what could have been a nice local coffee joint.  If you're not a self-important MOTH or a tourist who's going for the Insta, avoid this place like the plague.

A fantastic wine bar! Great small dishes, but I wouldn't plan on a full meal here. The staff is incredibly knowledgeable, friendly, and patient. If you know what you like they will bring it right out and if you are a little unsure, they go beyond expectations to help you out. Always a great experience!
Not impressed. Overpriced mediocre food.

With Little Pearl, I have now successfully visited every Aaron Silverman institution in the District! I was devastated when I heard that coffee and pastries would no longer be served at Pineapple & Pearls, as they did an amazing job with both (I LOVED the pistachio rose tea cakes!). However, Little Pearl opened up relatively soon after and became the stylish coffeehouse and wine bar we all craved and wanted.  By day, Little Pearl serves as the place for your caffeine needs. Coffee, espresso drinks, tea, hot chocolate, chai, iced banana latte, coconut nutmeg latte, London Fog, and even affogato.  They also get creative with sandwiches, and you can find a breakfast wrap of eggs, potatoes, and gruyere available until 11:30am or a smoked brisket, fried chicken, eggplant parm, and even a lobster roll here. If you're trying to keep your resolutions and build that summer bod, they have salads too (and I'm talking farro and winter greens with housemade yogurt, not a Caesar salad). Or if you've got a sweet tooth, they have plenty of pastries - sweet potato and turnip tart, cinnamon roll, potato donut, bread pudding, hot churros - and even gelato. I've tried the coconut nutmeg latte and the eggplant parm and they're both divine.  At night, Little Pearl dons its 21+ menu of cocktails and wine. There aren't a ton of selections, but you'll probably find something you like given their tastes.  You can make reservations online for the evenings, but they do keep half their dining room tables available for walk-ins. Otherwise during the day, it's first come, first serve. Great place for a cup of Joe, lunchtime plans with friends, or a fun date in the evening!

This is one of those places that feels like it belongs in Brooklyn or Copenhagen, which make me apprehensive, but it is so close to my house and the coffee and food is very good. The salmon plate is exceptionally delicious and fresh.
I love their brisket sandwich for lunch.  I get it to carry out
Iced banana latte is delish!
Perfect date spot, with an open seating concept for the house on the corner. The snacks are fantastically whimsical. Service is stellar.
The chicken sandwich is devine. It's so good you won't mind the crowds.
Would have been great but food was too salty and the lighting too dim. Good attempt at a cool new place but failed in just a few key ways.
Lovely staff with excellent food and drink inside a wonderful atmosphere.
Amazing food.  Love the Gravalax and Eggplant Parm. The Baristas are first rate. The design transports me to Copenhagen!
It’s so cute and quaint. Totally recommend it!
Cozy, cute, delicious, light-filled, and fun. Favorite neighborhood café and wine bar!
Great brunch spot with large outdoor area to people watch in fashionable capitol hill.

Breakfast review: Charming! Pretty setting, good selection of small treats and hearty food. Service was very friendly and the food was memorable. Loved the house made hazelnut milk in my latte and the brisket sammie.
Very cool place - good coffee, good lunch (although small menu food was very good). Came for lunch and will definitely be back!
The chicken sandwich is a must try. I had the spicy version. Delicious! There was a long line to order and limited seating. We sat at the community table. It was worth the wait and crowd.
Potato donut is amazing! Chai tea latte as long very good, not too sweet, not too spicy. ❤️
The wait staff were exceptional, and I enjoyed my wine and the burger special.

This place is everything you want in a neighborhood cafe. It’s adorable and the food is high quality. There’s creativity and thought behind the menu and the staff are kind and helpful. And the music is always on point. Great place to work during the week or catch up with friends on the weekend.
Cute little cafe
It’s the bee’s knees.
Best ☕ shop in town
This place is great! It's very modern and calm. The food is exceptional and they probably have the best potato doughnut in dc. I will continue to go every day I can!

Little Pearl isn't so tiny in heart. When Aaron Silverman of Rose's Luxury and Pineapple and Pearl fame announced he was opening a coffee shop on Capitol Hill, a few things were stacked up against him: 1) He was taking over the space of a beloved Hill restaurant, Bayou, 2) The space is a historic building coming with limitations on design and function, 3) It's off of Barracks Row on the property of a community center with low traffic, and 4) One can argue the DC coffee scene is saturated. Well, Aaron and his team are fighters and Little Pearl overcame every obstacle to create a world-class coffee shop/wine bar. Here's why it's THE place to visit near Barracks Row:  1) Quality coffee and food: For a coffee shop, they have a large and diverse menu from the coffee shop regulars like a latte and a mocha. Then they have a few stand out items like pretzel gelato or caffeinated cocktails. In addition, they have sandwiches that are a full menu and if you're in search for the BEST FRIED CHICKEN SANDWICH IN THE DMV AREA, look no further. It's on its way to win awards!  2) The price: Little Pearl is classy. There's no questioning it. Because of that, you'd assume prices would be steep, but they are not. My decently sized latte was only $4 (a bit more with the preset 18% tip their checkout system added to it- you can change, but don't. They deserve a 50% tip). Maketto down the road on H Street NE charges much more than that for a latte and it's on par to this one (okay, Little Pearl's is better).  3) The atmosphere: It's in a historic cottage house with a Charleston design and charm. The brick flooring is something they couldn't change being a historic building, but it works with their brick white washed walls and marble bars. It's simple, yet regal. Even the two condiment areas are simple and classy. There's one side room with tables and one back glass enclosed patio area. When it's warm, they have plenty of outdoor seating.  4) The staff: With quality food and a name like Aaron Silverman behind it, Little Pearl has every right to own their success and be arrogant, but they are not. Each staff member is helpful, warm, and concerned for each customer. I met Casey, who I assume if the lead manager, and she is a great person.  5) The personality: When you least expect it, they mold a bit of humor into their brand. If you use the bathroom closest to the bar area, you'll see a Andy Warhol inspired painting of bananas on the wall. It works with the simple design inside the bathroom and it's not cheesy at all. It's subtly hilarious and it works.  When you step inside and experience Little Pearl for a minute, you can't help but give them a standing ovation for overcoming the obstacles, winning the hearts of Capitol Hill, and doing it with such grace and class. Little Pearl, you are a neighbor welcome to stay...forever. I raise my latte to that.
